title: Magdalena Lederbauer
text:
e-mail
  

  
  
Welcome to my personal website! I am a visiting graduate student at MIT and master‚Äôs student at ETH Zurich with a focus on digital chemistry, catalysis, and chemical engineering. I am interested in spectroscopy (in particular, mass spectrometry for meachine-learning assisted structural elucidation of small molecules), transition metal and digital chemistry.


Academic CV   Portfolio of recent projects


For any inquiries, please do get in touch via social media or e-mail.






[24/10] I joined the Massachusetts Institute of Technology for my master‚Äôs thesis! In the Department of Chemical Engineering in the group of Connor W. Coley, I am working on structure elucidation of mass spectra using neural networks. My work is supported by the Zeno Karl Schindler Master‚Äôs Thesis Grant, Excellence Scholarship and Opportunity Programme and the Swiss European Mobility Programme.
[24/03] I started working as a research intern in the Laboratory of Artificial Chemical Intelligence (LIAC) at EPFL! I will be working with Philippe Schwaller and Andres M. Bran on large language model agents in heterogeneous catalysis. Our work won a poster award at the Faraday Discussions in data-driven discovery in the chemical sciences in Oxford, UK.
[23/09] I am starting my master‚Äôs studies in chemistry at ETH Zurich, supported by the Excellence Scholarship and Opportunity Program (ESOP) by the ETH Foundation.

title: Magdalena Lederbauer
text:
By The Way
A recent passion project of mine is combining chemical education with digital chemistry. I‚Äôve started a blog called ByteSizedChem ‚Äì it‚Äôs a work in progress ‚Äì to share my findings and tips for new students getting started in this exciting field. Feedback always welcome!

title: Press
text:
For any press inquiries, please do get in touch via e-mail.

[2024] Feature Frau des Monats, M√§rz 2024 (DE). Woman of the month, March 2024, at my former high school. Highlighting young women in STEM, initiated by my high school, Wiedner Gymnasium ‚Äì Sir Karl Popper Schule. A big kudos to all the teachers who have inspired me throughout my career.
[2024] Article Nieder√∂sterreichische Nachrichten (DE) Press article in Lower Austria‚Äôs local press about my master studies at ETH Zurich.
[2023] Portrait by the Austrian Academy of Sciences Study Foundation (DE) A portrait of members of the Austrian Academy of Science‚Äôs study foundation. I am a member of the first cohort in 2019 ‚Äì the foundation has grown considerably since then. A big kudos to the coordination and social media team of the study foundation for interviewing me about my studies and visions as a young scientist.
[2023] Get to know the new excellence scholarship holders at D-CHAB (EN/DE). Feature of the excellence scholarship holders of the department of chemistry and applied biosciences at ETH Zurich. I highlight what motivates me about my studies and the science I plan to pursue. Thank you to the D-CHAB‚Äôs social media team for interviewing us!
[2023] Article about our involvement as authors of the International Chemistry Olympiad in Switzerland (EN/DE) For the first time, the International Chemistry Olympiad took part in Zurich, Switzerland. After three years as a participant myself, I joined the exam author team and co-authored questions for the theory part of the competition. This article highlights Stefan Schmid‚Äôs and mine involvment in the chemistry olympiad.
[2023] Portrait of the authors of the IChO 2023 Catalyzer The science communication team of the young Swiss Chemical Society joined forces to supply the Catalyzer (the IChO‚Äôs magazine) with short articles about Swiss Nobel Laureates in chemistry, the chemistry of chocolate, the Swiss education system etc. I am super proud of our science commumnication team!
[2023] Podcast FM4 Anfang 20 (DE) Podcast episode by the Austrian radio network FM4 on my experiences as the student of a school for gifted young adults.
[2022] Feature of the scholarship holders of the excellence program of studies abroad by Lower Austria. The Lower Austrian agency for research promotion awards excellence scholarships to students who pursue studies abroad. The Lower Austrian government visited ETH and met my colleague Jarmila Frimlova and me.
[2021] Article Nieder√∂sterreichische Nachrichten (DE) Press article in Lower Austria‚Äôs local press about my bachelor studies at ETH Zurich.
[2020] Article N√ñN (DE) Press article in Lower Austria‚Äôs local press about my bachelor studies at ETH Zurich (during the COVID-19 pandemic).
[2020] Club Alpbach Scholarship for the Lower Austrian cohort. Due to COVID-19 outbreak in 2020, the retreat was held in Lower Austria. Being 18 years old, I am the youngest of the 20 scholarship holders of that year.
[2020] Podcast (DE) Podcast about gifted education An interview of me as a former student of the Sir Karl Popper Schule as well as a successful ‚Äúchemistry olympian‚Äù. I am giving detailed insights into everyday school life at the Sir Karl Popper Schule, tells what makes it a special school for me and reveal why the best gingerbread spice recipe has something to do with science!
[2019] Jump-start into science, ORF (DE) A piece by the Austrian Broadcasting Corporation (ORF) on young women in STEM, highlighting my colleague Nina Mitrovic‚Äôs and my achievements in science olympiads.
[2019] 25 talents that will change your business model (DE) I was featured by one of the leading industry magazines in Austria during my time as an ‚Äúolympian‚Äù in the chemistry olympiad. As a result, I took part in the 2019 industry congress ‚ÄúGAINER‚Äù festival in Linz, Austria.
[2019] Feature of the training for the European Science Olympiad 2019 (DE) I co-lead the mentoring team for chemistry in 2019. We are super proud for our team to have scored a gold and a bronze medal in the Europe-wide finale in Portugal! üéâ
[2019] Feature by the PH NOE of the winners of the 2019 Austrian National Chemistry Olympiad (DE)
[2019] Article Wiener Zeitung (DE)
[2019] Feature by KURIER of the winners of the 2019 Austrian National Chemistry Olympiad (DE)
[2019] Article Nieder√∂sterreichische Nachrichten (DE)
[2019] Feature Wienerin des Monats, Juli 2019. Viennese of the month, July 2019. (DE)
[2018] Feature of the winning teams of the European Science Olympiad 2018 (DE) I am beyond proud and excited for our team!

title: Portfolio
text: I have been active in a number of academic and extracurricular projects. Here are some of them; click on the respective panels to find out more:

title: Portfolio
text:
Hackathons





GlossaGen: An automated glossary generation tool for academics
Winner (Knowledge Graph Prize & Second Place) of the 2024 Global Hackathon on LLMs in Chemistry and Materials Science. My team created an AI-powered glossary generation tool for technical documents.








RAMBO: Initializing BO, the smart way
Contribution to the 2024 BO&Materials Hackathon hosted by the Acceleration Consortium.








SynSearch: Leveraging LLMs for chemical synthesis
Winner of the 2023 Hackathon on Generative AI hosted by the Swiss Data Science Center. My team designed a tool to aid experimental chemists in designing their experiments by leveraging chemical literature with large language models.

title: Portfolio
text:
Outreach





ByteSizedChem
A recent passion project of mine; a blog about navigating digital chemistry as a young student.








Women in Natural Sciences (at ETH Zurich and beyond)
XXX








Teaching
At ETH Zurich, we get an enormous amount of value from learning from older peers who work as Teaching Assistants. Over the course of my studies, I worked as one as well, and ended up leading a team of five TAs for a 180+ undergraduate student Chemistry lecture. Click for thoughts and useful resources.








Mentoring Students: The Chemistry Olympiad
Even though I am a young student myself, mentorship is important to me. I strongly believe in the value that people who are ‚Äú1-2 steps ahead‚Äù can provide.
